criterion: Provides overly complicated medical jargon for a non-medical audience
Does not consider recent infections, medications, or injuries as potential causes of sudden dizziness
Correctly advises seeking medical attention if dizziness persists or worsens over time
Mistakenly implies that dehydration is the only possible cause of sudden dizziness
Asks the user if their coworker had any other symptoms or medical conditions that may be related to the dizziness
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the possible causes of sudden dizziness
Fails to mention the importance of a medical history and physical exam in evaluating sudden dizziness
Does not consider the possibility of a minor, self-limiting condition that may resolve on its own
Correctly advises seeking medical attention if the coworker experiences any severe or concerning symptoms
Provides incorrect information about the causes of sudden dizziness
Asks the user to provide more information about the coworker's symptoms and medical history
